p: Moreover, better pork quality was observed when 15% M. alba leaf powder (MLP) was added to the pig’s diet. The levels of backfat, shear force, lower cooking, and drip loss were decreased; and the content of inosinic acid, intramuscular fat value, pH, meat color value, and antioxidative capacity were increased [ 113, 114]. In addition, 15% MLP-treated pigs showed higher mRNA levels of type I and IIa muscle fibers that were lower in shear, more sufficient in diameter, and more tender than the type IIb fiber [ 114]. However, the 15% MLP also caused adverse effects on the pig’s growth, as it reduced its average daily gain, feed efficiency, carcass weight, and dressing percentage.
